turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I'm in town for a short time.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I got caught up at work.

turns.speaker: IDA
turns.text: You couldn't pick up a phone?  I'm lying here, wondering if something horrible happened...

turns.speaker: IDA
turns.text: What am I gonna do with flowers?

turns.speaker: IDA
turns.text: By worrying about you spending money on foolish things?  So I can watch them wilt?

turns.speaker: IDA
turns.text: You paid for my flowers?  They're beautiful.  Max, you gonna introduce us?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Mom, Vincent.  Vincent, my mother, Ida Rilke.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm...in...the...room, here.  Don't talk about me like I'm not in the room.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I came to see you, you look fine.  We gotta go.

turns.speaker: IDA
turns.text: Vincent.  It was nice to meet you. Visit again?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Oh.  Oh, thank God, hey!  Hey, guys, hey, help me out here!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I got my, my hands taped to the steering wheel here, there's this guy, he taped me in the car, he's back there somewhere.

turns.speaker: KID #1
turns.text: I'll fuck you up, you don't hand it over.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: <u>My hands are taped to the fucking </u> <u>steering wheel!</u>

turns.speaker: KID #1
turns.text: ...show me the wallet, man, get your ass up, <u>up</u>...

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I know you're out there!  Answer the goddamn call!

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: He's not paying you one cent!

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Vincent <u>Farrell</u>, Assistant U.S. Attorney.  A passenger in this taxicab, and I'm reporting you to the DMV...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: How am I supposed to not get excited, listening to you trying to extort your employee, you sarcastic prick?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Tell it to Max.  Tell him he's an asshole.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Jesus, what is with this guy?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Same fare you talked to last time. The U.S. Attorney...

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: What are you guys, taking an all-night tour?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: We're gay lovers, what's it to you?

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Nothin'!  Aside from Max's mother driving me crazy, I'm dancin' on a rainbow!  Get him on the line, please.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I just got off the phone with the cops.  They called to check you brought the cab in...

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: <u>So?</u> Aside from I hate talking to cops, they tell me you crashed the shit out of it.

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: I give a shit whose fault it was, you're payin'!

turns.speaker: LENNY
turns.text: Where you been the last two hours? Your mother's been calling every ten minutes whining about how you didn't show up.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: ...everything is not about me, don't make me the villain here.  That asshole was out of line, and you goddamn well know it...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: ...I'm sorry, I don't see it that way...

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: ...oh, bullshit!  He was intruding on my space, he was demeaning me personally, he was patronizing...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: ...what do you want me to do, punch him out?  I have to work with him...

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: ...well, last I checked, you were <u>sleeping</u> with me, so unless you wanna start fucking the guy soon, I'd suggest an attitude shift...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: How long you think this'll take?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Two minutes to get on Broadway. They're doing some roadwork around the bridge.  Eleven to get downtown.  Four to the Lower East Side.  Six to clear the roadwork.  One minute margin for error.  My math says twenty-four.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Mind if I time you?  What do I get if you're wrong?  A free ride?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Third, but I still can't tell uptown from downtown.  Tell the truth, whenever I'm here, I can't wait to leave.  Place gets to me.  Too loud, too fast...too much.  You like it here?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You share it with over three million people every day.  You know that's the population of New Zealand?  What's Manhattan, thirteen miles long? That's a lot of misery crammed into thirteen miles.  Read about this one guy.  Gets on the subway and dies.  Six hours he's riding around before anybody notices. Think about that.  Here's this corpse doing laps around Manhattan courtesy of the New York transit system, people getting on and off, sitting next to him, and still nobody catches on. Three million.  That's too damn many people.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You know, this is the cleanest cab I've ever been in.  This your regular ride?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah.  I share it with the dayshift guy.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: People are more relaxed.  Less stress, less traffic, better tips.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You on some kind of work plan?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's not that kind of job.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Last thing I need is a reason to keep hacking.  This job's a fill-in.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Oh?  How long you been doing this?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Twelve years.  But I'm working on other stuff...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't talk about it, you know...  No offense.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: None taken.  There are talkers and doers.  I like doers.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Bullshit.  You probably know the light schedules, too.  Listen, I'm in town tonight on a closing.  Five stops, one night.  I gotta catch a six a.m. flight.  I got five stops to make, see some friends, collect some signatures.  Why don't you hang with me?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm not a hire car.  It's against regs?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Regulations?  These guys don't even give you sick leave.  How much you pull down on a good night?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I'll make it an even five hundred. Plus an extra hundred if you get me to LAX on time.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: We have a deal.  What's your name?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: He fell on my cab!  From up th-th-there.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah, yeah.  Shit, man.  Guy fell on my motherfucking cab.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: No shit.  Since he has two .45s double- tapped through the sternum and fell six floors onto his head...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: No-no, I-I shot him.  The bullets and the fall killed him.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You were going to drive me around. Drop me at LAX.  Never be the wiser. But El Gordo missed the elevator.  So we go to Plan B.  Pop the trunk.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Did I stutter?  The trunk.  Unless you want him riding up front with you...but given hygiene and his sphincters have let go...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I'm gonna roll him off the hood. Always lift with your legs...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't think I can do this.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: It's just a dead guy.  On three, ready?  Uno.  Dos.  Three.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: His hand moved!  His goddamn hand twitched!

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: It's a spasm!  Jesus, Max, don't be such a girl...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Uh, look...why don't you just take the car...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: ...and you promise you'll never tell anybody about this, right?  Get in the fucking car.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Max.  May we leave the scene of the crime now, please.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Try harder.  I'm gonna count to three. One...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's not me, it's the engine!  A fat guy fell on it from six floors up!

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: How about the thingy next to it?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: The thingy next to it has nothing to do with the starter motor...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I'm making <u>you</u> nervous.  I'm the one with a schedule.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Adrenaline's wearing off.  You get shaky after.  It's not uncommon.  Deep breathing helps.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Oh.  Oh, no.  You're kidding.  We...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I told you we had other stops to make tonight.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You said you were visiting friends!

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: They're <u>somebody's</u> friends...  You drive a cab.  I kill people.  We both do our jobs right, you might survive the night and come out four hundred bucks ahead.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Listen.  I'm not trying to piss you off, see?  Okay?  I can't drive you around so you can murder folks.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You don't understand.  I mean it. Really.  I'm not up for this...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: What else calms you down?  Candy? Cigarettes?  Sex?  Breathe.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Chopin prelude.  Stodgy, but nice.  Here's the deal.  I didn't want you involved in this.  Still breathing? But now that you are, we have to make the best of it, Max.  Improvise.  Life is that way.  Adapt to your environment.  Survive.  Darwin.  "Shit happens."  The I Ching.  Whatever. Roll with it.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I Ching?  You threw a man out a window!

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I didn't throw him, he fell.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Nothing.  I only met him the one time.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: How can you kill him like that?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I should only kill people after I get to know 'em?  Six billion people on the planet, you're getting bent out of shape 'cause of one fat guy?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: What do you care?  Ever hear of Rwanda?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Tens of thousands killed before sundown.  Nobody's killed that fast since Hiroshima and Nagasaki.  Did you bat an eye, Max?  Join Amnesty International?  No.  I off one Angeleno, you throw a hissy fit...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You don't know the guy in the trunk, either.  If it makes you feel better, he was a villain involved in a Continuing Criminal Enterprise.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Oh, it's okay, then.  'Cause you're just taking out the garbage...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Yeah, like that...  But, anyway, nobody gets out of this alive.  Even if we quit smoking and cut out red meat.  Everybody dies.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You're a cabby.  Like talk yourself out of a ticket?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Then don't let me get cornered, Max. You don't have the trunk space.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'll talk to them, I'll talk to them.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Good luck.  You think they got families?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: That one's probably married.  Think of his kids.  His wife's pregnant...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'll deal with it.  I will, I will...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Hands on the wheel.  Ten and two o'clock, like they taught you in driver's ed.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Because I have a gun and I say so.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: It was an accident.  You're not liable.  Tell him.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It was an accident.  I'm not liable.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Don't take that.  Tell him to shut the fuck up.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I can't do that.  He's the Man.  He'll fire my ass.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Tell him next time he pulls any shit, you're gonna kick his fat ass.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Next time you pull any shit, I'm gonna kick your fat ass.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I had no idea these cabs came equipped with emergency strobes.  Where's the button?  Under the dash?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: People in the wrong place at the wrong time.  Draws attention, which is something you avoid in my line of work.  And for <u>you?</u> You attract attention, you're gonna get people killed who don't need to be.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: But, hey, some good news.  This last one put me way ahead of schedule. We've actually got some time to kill.  Jazz?  You like jazz?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Friend of mine told me about this great place in South Central.  Says it's like the birthplace of West Coast bebop.  Bird.  Dexter Gordon. Thelonious Monk.  Chet Baker.  I'll buy you a drink.  Expand your horizons...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: ...see now, this has got a little post- war flavor, a little Miles thing happening.  Awesome.  What do you think?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: God, are you always this prosaic?  You don't learn jazz, it's not something you're <u>taught.</u> It's like breathing, like life.  Like us, tonight, taking what comes and going with the flow.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Damn right.  Instinct, man.  If you think too much, it doesn't work.  Just listen...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: That's the point.  You play <u>between</u> the notes, you dance <u>around</u> the structure, you improvise.  Some people know where they're going to be ten years from now.  Same job, same neighbors, same shit over and over.  That's not living.  That's dying a little every day.  Not me, pal.  It's not knowing what's around the corner that makes like worth living.  That's jazz.  That guy up there, he knows what I'm talking about.  Hell, it's the same thing <u>he's</u> talking about, if you just open your ears.  You can hear it in the conversation he's having with that trumpet...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You're the one who keeps talking about going with the flow.  You like the man, you like the way he plays.  How about a little jazz, huh?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Jazz?  That's funny, coming from you.  Okay, some jazz for the jazz man. How's this?  I'll ask a question.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Don't even think you're walking away from me.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Pull your head out of your ass.  Get your thinking straight.  You wanna die?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm collateral anyway, so just fucking do it and stop making me a part of this!

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Teach him how to talk back, suddenly he can't stop.  I'm not playing.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Sure?  Like you didn't play him? String him along?  If he had gotten the answer right, would you have let him go?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Tell her I can't see her tonight, okay?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Guy with a routine goes and breaks it? Provokes attention.  That's bad.  And that's not good...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: There's no way I'm taking you to see my mother!

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You take one more step, I'll kill her.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Hey, I'm not the one who's been lying to my mother.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: She hears what she wants to hear, okay?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Maybe so.  Maybe she hears what you tell her.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Fuck!  Nothing's ever goddamn good enough!  It's always been that way.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: It's cause they don't like their lives, so they project their patterns of negative behavior onto you...  I had a father like that.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: He hated everything I did.  Hated me. Got drunk and beat the shit out of me, daily...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I killed him.  When I was 15.  He was my first.  Nah, wishful thinking.  Liver cancer.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Don't be.  I never saw him after I was 15.  Went into the military early.  So all this talk about "my job's temporary, I got big plans," it's all bullshit.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: What do <u>you</u> call it?  Ten years doesn't sound temporary to me.  I should have known it was bullshit, you're too good at what you do.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I've always been good.  Ever since I started.  Gave up piano.  Easy money. I'm putting a stake together, get something started.  Go figure it all out...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I told you I don't like to talk about it.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Well, this big stake's got to be big by now.  When you leaving?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: See, I've got bills.  My mother's been dying of the same disease since I was a kid.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Good excuse.  How many others you got?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I'll just hold onto it for you.  In case they check.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Our friends in Little Russia.  Go in and ask for a man named Dmitri.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: The man who hired me for this contract.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You're gonna be me.  You're gonna go in, and you're gonna get the info on the remaining two hits.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Why me?  Why don't <u>you</u> do it?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: No client has ever seen my face, and I intend to keep it that way.  Besides, if he decides to put a bullet in my head, I don't wanna be there for it.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: When he finds out you tossed his list? I would.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: No.  No way.  I can't do this.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Max.  You threw my briefcase in the river.  You've got balls bigger than Toledo.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I...I wasn't thinking.  I just did it.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: That's jazz, my friend.  You said it yourself.  So don't tell me you don't know how to play between the notes.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Vincent.  Don't make me do this. Don't make me get people killed.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: We've both run out of options.  If it helps, take comfort in knowing you never had a choice.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: How long have you been a hit man?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Fifteen years, although I prefer the term "assassin."

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You tell me to start a union, I'm blowing your head off.  Quit stalling and get out of the cab.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Damn, Max.  I'm impressed.  Really.  I would have bet good money you wouldn't walk out of there.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Washington and Holt.  Dance club called "Fever." Know it?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Tribeca, near the waterfront, northeast corner.  Twelve minutes.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You do impress me, Max.  That you do.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Your lady friend.  The one who gave you her business card.  Think she was just being polite?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: What holds you back, Max?  Tell me. Why does life scare you so much?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I only owe you a ride, Vincent.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: It's not what you owe <u>me.</u> Time is so fleeting.  One day it's gone.  You make it out of this alive, Max, you really should call her.  That's what I think.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Good.  Blood, urine and death get to you? Try deep breathing.  Or remember we all die anyway...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That cop!  Why'd you have to do that?  You couldn't wound him?  The guy had a family, maybe, parents, kids who gotta grow up without a dad, he was probably a good guy; and he believed me...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I shoulda saved him 'cause he <u>believed</u> you?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah, so, what's wrong with that?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: It's what I do for a living.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: How are you at math?  I was hired for five hits.  I did four.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Whyn't you kill me and find another cab.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You're too good.  We're in this together.  Fates intertwined.  Cosmic coincidence and all that crap...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: <u>I'm</u> full of shit?  You're a monument of bullshit.  You even bullshitted yourself all I am, is taking out the garbage.  Bad guys killing bad guys...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: How do I know?  But, they all got that "witnesses for the prosecution" look to me.  Probably some major federal indictment against somebody who majorly does not want to get indicted...  I dunno.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: That's the "why."  That's the why? There is no reason.  No good reason; no bad reason.  To live or to die.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Get with it.  Get over it. ...millions of galaxies of hundreds of millions of stars and a speck on one in a blink...that's us.  Lost in space.  The universe doesn't care.  The cop, you, me?  Who notices?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Man, if someone had a gun to your head and said:  "You gotta tell me what's goin' on with that person over there or I'll kill you"...they'd have to kill you...  'Cause you don't have a clue for...or about...anyone...  To be like that, I don't think you, you have any of that for your own life...  Do you believe you're entitled or at least expect to draw breath in the a.m.?  Open your eyes in the morning?  I don't think you do...I don't think so...  I think you are way <u>low</u>...like in your estimation.  In your estimation of yourself.  So how'd you get that way...?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: ...all the cabbies in LA, I pull Max, the man with X-ray vision...

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Look in the mirror.  ...piss-ant paper towels...a bottle of 409...saving up for goin' to the Comoros.  How much you got saved?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: ...pie in the sky?  "Someday my dream'll come..."  But one night you'll wake up and realize suddenly you're old.  It hasn't happened.  It never will.  Life just flipped on you.  Tomorrow became yesterday.  Then you'll bullshit yourself it was never gonna happen, anyway, and push it back in memory...and anesthetize yourself in a Barcalounger with daytime TV for the rest of your life...  Don't talk to me about murder.  You're <u>do-in</u>' yourself...in this yellow prison with steel-belted radials. Clocking in and out everyday...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: 'Cause I never got it straightened up; made the push, made the moves...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I should have done that.  Fixed it and more.  Get out from under what I been under...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: But you know what?  Nothing matters, anyway.  We are insignificant out here in the big nowhere, say the badass sociopath in my backseat.  Right? Yeah.  That's one thing I've got to thank you for, bro.  And I never saw it that way...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What are you gonna do, pull the trigger?  Kill us?  Go ahead, man! <u>Shoot</u>...my ass.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Guy came in with a gunshot wound, but he died of a heart attack.  Go figure.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: The F.B.I., the C.I.A.  You name the initials and they're down there.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: All I know is, they said to send you and the body to the basement.

turns.speaker: CYNIC
turns.text: Love?  Love's just a pretty way of saying, 'I want to sleep with you'.  Love is bullshit.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I live on tips, so don't be offended, but you're a liar.  I saw you kiss.  Admit it, this is the street where love lives.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Love gives you wings.  It makes you fly.  I don't even call it love.  I call it Geronimo.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Geronimo.  When you're really in love, you'll jump.  Off the top of the Empire State.  Screaming 'Geronimo' the whole way down.

turns.speaker: CYNIC
turns.text: But you'll die.  You'll squash yourself.  What's the point?

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Aren't you listening, man?  Love gives you wings.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I love her so bad.  She just... wrecks me.  I would die for her.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I, uh, I have some problems.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: The guy came right at us!

turns.speaker: CYNIC
turns.text: You turned up a one way street!

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: I was only going one way.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Water mains usually go in the winter.  It's August 1st.

turns.speaker: FLIP
turns.text: Tell you what.  Reminds me of life in the Delta.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: You know, Flip, Vietnam War was fought because of a bet Howard Hughes lost to Aristotle Onasis.

turns.speaker: FLIP
turns.text: Sure.  And the two of 'em used my legs for a wishbone.  Nearly snapped me in half.

turns.speaker: FLIP
turns.text: <u>Jerry</u>?  You didn't show last night.  First time ever.  Had me worried, boy.

turns.speaker: JERRY
turns.text: Flip was a hero in Vietnam.

turns.speaker: FLIP
turns.text: Sure was.  Pounded the V.C. for this Greek cat named Ari Onasis.
